topics.body:
"@Bryon":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53dd0c4763687257766d0000#post_53dd0c4763687257766d0000

"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53dd0939636872653b2d0100#post_53dd0939636872653b2d0100
I look to science for the progress, I look to God for guidance. Science gives us the means for accomplishment whilst God serves as a moral code. 

Besides, not all praying folk are ignorant primates. A lot of them actually contribute to the progress of humanity.

I'm a Roman Catholic by the way.

A good way to look at it, Albus. I myself am Christian, though I like to also have the faith that comes from religion as well as knowing the facts science has given us, but I also make sure to respect all other religions no matter if someone is Atheist (I have a friend in New York who's one), Jewish, Muslim, Buddhist, or whatever.
